title: ICE "no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued" in nightly 2022-11-20

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code Code is available at [MilkFather/rustc-ice-221120](https://github.com/MilkFather/rustc-ice-221120). ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DropGlue(DefId(2:2801 ~ core[590f]::ptr::drop_in_place), Some(hyper::proto::h1::dispatch::Server) -> impl std::future::Future, std::convert::Infallible>> {jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::transport::http::reject_connection::{closure#0}::reject}, jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::logger::Body>, jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::logger::Body>)) (after phase change to runtime-optimized) at bb0[0]: Field projection `(*_1).field[0]` specified type `std::pin::Pin>>>`, but actual type is `std::pin::Pin) -> impl std::future::Future, std::convert::Infallible>> {jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::transport::http::reject_connection::{closure#0}::reject}, jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::logger::Body> as hyper::service::http::HttpService>::Future>>>` | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_const_eval/src/transform/validate.rs:88:36 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1591:13 stack backtrace: 0: 0x108d2d132 - ::fmt::h439ad59891a6d893 1: 0x108d8bb8a - core::fmt::write::hc6febfea48992551 2: 0x108d1f3ec - std::io::Write::write_fmt::h25befaf232726d5d 3: 0x108d2cefa - std::sys_common::backtrace::print::he983e0dd711e6589 4: 0x108d30226 - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::hbd746f32dacb7b9e 5: 0x108d2ff77 - std::panicking::default_hook::h0bd2fa66d45f4333 6: 0x1190db07d - rustc_driver[f66184a09ea1af9]::DEFAULT_HOOK::{closure#0}::{closure#0} 7: 0x108d30a0d - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hf33328f60da8c5e5 8: 0x11dade5e7 - std[a80ca8a44b17762]::panicking::begin_panic::::{closure#0} 9: 0x11dadc8a9 - std[a80ca8a44b17762]::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_end_short_backtrace::::{closure#0}, !> 10: 0x11dee72e9 - std[a80ca8a44b17762]::panicking::begin_panic:: 11: 0x11dace3d9 - std[a80ca8a44b17762]::panic::panic_any:: 12: 0x11dad5285 - ::flush_delayed::, &str> 13: 0x11dad1069 - ::drop 14: 0x11905f58a - core[590ff3257fc61341]::ptr::drop_in_place:: 15: 0x119060cfb - core[590ff3257fc61341]::ptr::drop_in_place:: 16: 0x1190c78ae - core[590ff3257fc61341]::ptr::drop_in_place:: 17: 0x1190b12f9 - rustc_span[6cad3b576cc36359]::with_source_map::, rustc_interface[f7516dff5d7731bd]::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver[f66184a09ea1af9]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#1}> 18: 0x1190a86ec - >::set::, rustc_driver[f66184a09ea1af9]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[590ff3257fc61341]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[8d925088020ddfb8]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 19: 0x11907096a - std[a80ca8a44b17762]::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_begin_short_backtrace::, rustc_driver[f66184a09ea1af9]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[590ff3257fc61341]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[8d925088020ddfb8]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core[590ff3257fc61341]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[8d925088020ddfb8]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 20: 0x119052eab - <::spawn_unchecked_, rustc_driver[f66184a09ea1af9]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[590ff3257fc61341]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[8d925088020ddfb8]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core[590ff3257fc61341]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[8d925088020ddfb8]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#1} as core[590ff3257fc61341]::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once::{shim:vtable#0} 21: 0x108d39dc7 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::h935368a05c7abfbe 22: 0x7ff81df254e1 - __pthread_start note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.67.0-nightly (c5d82ed7a 2022-11-19) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental=[REDACTED] note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden ```
Backtrace

``` 0: std::panicking::begin_panic:: 1: std::panic::panic_any:: 2: ::flush_delayed::, &str> 3: ::drop 4: core::ptr::drop_in_place:: 5: core::ptr::drop_in_place:: 6: core::ptr::drop_in_place:: 7: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#1}> 8: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```

I ran a bisect before writing this issue, it says the regression came from `nightly-2022-11-20`, and everything worked fine in `nightly-2022-11-19`.
